text: Walter Hallstein (17 November 1901 â€“ 29 March 1982) was a German academic, diplomat, and politician. He was the first president of the Commission of the European Economic Community. He was one of the founding fathers of the European Union. Hallstein is also the person behind the Hallstein Doctrine, wich the former state of West Germany proclaimed in 1955.
